events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving a collision with another vehicle on a busy street last night around 8 PM.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on the report describing car collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and provide direct assistance.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been officially acknowledged and logged.
The insurance company requested additional documents including police report, photos of the vehicles, and repair estimates.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police report and repair shop evaluation for the damaged vehicle.
The claims investigation department began reviewing the submitted evidence and statements regarding the car collision incident.
Investigators completed their review and confirmed the circumstances of the auto accident as described by the customer.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to cover repair costs based on the damage assessment of the vehicle collision.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and appreciated the clear communication throughout.
Final approval was granted for the insurance claim, authorizing payment for the approved amount to the customer.
The insurance company issued payment to the customerâ€™s account to cover the auto repair costs after claim approval.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and customer satisfaction with resolution.
All documents and communication related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
